content:
Diagnosis:		Grade III invasive ductal carcinoma left breast, pT2 (35mm) pN1 (2/17) M0,
			ER strongly positive (7/8), PR positive (6/8), HER2 negative,
			BRCA2 pathogenic variant.

Treatment:		Left therapeutic mastectomy and axillary dissection 12.04.2021.
			Completed adjuvant dose-dense AC-T chemotherapy 08.2021.
			Adjuvant chest wall radiotherapy 40Gy/15# completed 10.2021.
			Risk-reducing right mastectomy with immediate reconstruction
			12.2021.
			Commenced adjuvant anastrozole 01.2022.
			Diagnosed with thoracic spine and pelvic bone metastases 05.2023.
			Palbociclib/fulvestrant 05.2023-11.2023.
			Capecitabine 12.2023-03.2024 - ceased due to disease progression.
			Everolimus/exemestane 04.2024-06.2024 - discontinued after
			progression.
			Carboplatin 07.2024-12.2024 - achieved partial response but
			discontinued due to cumulative thrombocytopenia.
			Palliative RT to L3 vertebra 20Gy/5# 01.2025.
			Weekly paclitaxel initiated 02.2025.

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today with support from the breast care nurse. She attended Acute Oncology services last week reporting new onset left-sided ptosis and diplopia, necessitating postponement of scheduled paclitaxel treatment.?

On examination, there is partial left third nerve palsy with pupillary sparing and mild ptosis. Urgent MRI brain revealed a solitary 2.1cm enhancing lesion in the left cavernous sinus with local mass effect. She was started on dexamethasone 4mg three times daily with marked improvement in symptoms.? Now maintained on 4mg twice daily.?

Given the isolated nature of this intracranial disease and ongoing systemic disease control elsewhere, we have discussed stereotactic radiosurgery as a local treatment option. This will require careful consideration of dose constraints given her extensive treatment history. Today's paclitaxel will proceed as planned, and her case will be discussed at next week's Neuro-Oncology MDT. A dedicated radiotherapy planning consultation will be arranged thereafter.? Formal response assessment imaging is scheduled after completion of cycle 12.

primary_cancer.metastases: thoracic spine and pelvic bone metastases, left cavernous sinus metastasis
primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER strongly positive (7/8), PR positive (6/8), HER2 negative, BRCA2 pathogenic variant

cancer_timeline.value: Left therapeutic mastectomy and axillary dissection - 2/17 nodes positive
Risk-reducing right mastectomy with immediate reconstruction
Diagnosed with thoracic spine and pelvic bone metastases
Discontinued capecitabine due to disease progression
Discontinued carboplatin due to cumulative thrombocytopenia
2.1cm enhancing lesion in the left cavernous sinus with local mass effect

patient_facts.value: partial left third nerve palsy with pupillary sparing and mild ptosis

status_updates.value: Metastatic breast cancer progressed through multiple lines of endocrine therapy and chemotherapy. On weekly paclitaxel with new finding of isolated brain metastasis, being evaluated for stereotactic radiosurgery with symptomatic improvement on corticosteroids.
Today's paclitaxel will proceed as planned
Started on dexamethasone 4mg three times daily, now maintained on 4mg twice daily
Formal response assessment imaging scheduled after completion of cycle 12
Case to be discussed at next week's Neuro-Oncology MDT, followed by dedicated radiotherapy planning consultation
